poem:
"Pen Upon the Flesh"

In the silence of words,
A saga spins, slow-burning,
Kinship a kindled parchment,
Truth to flame turning.

Voiceless echoes of existence,
Religious lines shading in,
An embroidery of ethics,
In the weave of the kin.

Pentagonal patterns in prose,
An author's sacred rite,
For are we not all scribes,
Inscribing love with light.
